string.Text: Closed captions. Press the spacebar to toggle captions on and off.
Skip navigation. Press enter to return to the slide.

links.displaytext: The telephone is a vital tool in our industry. Often the person who answers the phone will be a guest's first point of contact for your hotel or department, so creating a great first impression is all important! Let's see July's recommendations next.
Hi Sam, can you share some tips for using the telephone at work?

Sure July. Here are my recommendations:

 When the phone rings, stop whatever else you are doing
 Answer the phone within three rings or less
 Speak slowly and clearly
 Be ready with a pad and pencil, for accuracy repeat names, room numbers and messages
 Be sure that you are accurate and careful when taking a message
 Read the message back to the caller to confirm details are correct
 When transferring a call to another department, ensure all calls are announced - (warm transfer)
 ALWAYS INJECT G-STAR INTO THE CALL!!!
Thanks Sam. Seems very easy to do!
